subject: CYCLING, TRACK
OLYMPIC GAMES
OLYMPIC GAMES (2012)
lead_paragraph: LONDON -- North of Olympic Park, an arena looms in the distance, its roof curved in an odd and yet unmistakable slope. The roof reaches its highest point at either end and sags in the middle, until it forms what architects call a truncated hyperbolic paraboloid. Translated into less technical terms, the arena, the Olympic Velodrome, is shaped like a Pringles potato chip.
snippet: Track racing begins Thursday at the Olympic Velodrome, known as the Pringle, which has become as much a rock star as the athletes who will compete inside it.
